intro: Agoseris caudata, commonly known as the long-tailed goldeneye, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its yellowish flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a rough texture. Agoseris caudata is adapted to dry conditions and is often found in regions with well-drained soils.
